oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sociality in pre- and post-wean beef calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Parsons, R.
Robbins, J.
Dewell, R.
Dewll, G.
Johnson, A.
Haley, D.
Millman, S.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bonding between beef cows and their calves is well established; however, social relationships between calves is less under足stood. In wild ungulates, young calf integration into the natal herd is typically facilitated by its dam based in part on her pre足existing social rank and relationships. Weaning stress occurs when calves are transitioned off milk to solid feed and are com足monly separated from their dam. Research is lacking on pref足erential relationships between calves during both the pre-wean and the post-wean periods. The objective of this study was to explore the relationships between calves during both the pre-wean and post-wean periods.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; No. 56 (2023): 2023 Annual Conference Proceedings ; 240
